event.title: named Paradise in the summer of 1885

data.event: Virinda Longmire named Paradise in the summer of 1885 while she viewed the wildflowers in the alpine meadows there.
62% of the over 1.3 million people who visited the park in 2000 went to Paradise.

Paradise is the location of the historic Paradise Inn (built 1916), Paradise Guide House (built 1920) and Henry M. Jackson Visitor Center (built 1966; replaced 2008; original building demolished 2009).
